page.title: 19ECOLOGY
page.content: The climate of Havant is typical of southern England-warm and sunny in summer,and cold and wet in winter.The high average daily sunshine hour count makes this climate temperate.Winter weather consists of snow on high ground,and gales and rain.Average summer temperatures are 20-30 degrees centigrade,and generally warm and sunny.Little rain.Flora and fauna include such plantlife as wildflowers, reeds and bullrushes,and Oak,Beech,Elm trees.Fauna includes rodents,small snakes,urban foxes,grey squirrels, feral cats,and stray dogs.Many stables are based here.Seashore and garden birds include Kestrels and waders. Canada geese cause problems by grazing on crops.Footpaths include the Hayling Billy,The Wayfarers Way,The Solent Way,and a large network of local footpaths.
